frameworks.openingRemark: Node.js is the first and foremost tool to install.

highlights.description: Node.js handles the installation of open source applications through NPM, the package manager for the Node.js server platform.

Node functions as a warehouse of third-party applications, while NPM not only delivers the packages but installs the code and manages the code dependencies. All node_module installations are run through the command line.

steps.list-step: 2. Click the install button and follow the directions
3. Make sure the package is installed into /usr/local/bin

frameworks.openingRemark: Yeoman scaffolds high quality working web applications. Most projects made by the development team are first built by Yeoman.

highlights.description: Yeoman combines several functions e.g., creating a starter template, managing dependencies, and providing a local development server. Angular, Assemble, Backbone are the types of projects, but not limited to, that can be instantiated through Yeoman.

frameworks.closingRemarks: Grunt and Bower are components of Yeoman, no extra installation is needed. When Yo creates a projects, a Gruntfile.js and bower_components.json are instantiated.

frameworks.openingRemark: Sass is a stable, powerful CSS extension, such as allowing mechanisms availble in OO languages.

highlights.description: Sass supports variable declaration, nesting, mixins, arguments, and selector inheritance.

steps.list-step: 2. If you get an error message, then use the sudo command to install the Sass gem

steps.list-step-helper: The terminal should print out Sass 3.4.13

highlights.description: Handlebars.js is compatible with Mustache.js, but can handel extensibility and minimal logic with #if, #unless, #with, and #each helpers.

steps.list-step-helper: Handlebars does not provide a global installation, but can be downloaded from handlebars.com or be installed through Bower.
The files will need to be added to the scripts folder in the project manually.
For Bower install, open the terminal

frameworks.closingRemarks: If you created an assemble project, handlebars files have already been imported.
